Package database

Class RentalDAO

java.lang.Object
database.RentalDAO
public class RentalDAO extends Object
A class that provides methods to interact with the rentals table in the database.

    • addRental

      public static boolean addRental(Rental rental) throws SQLException
      Adds a new rental to the database.
      Parameters:
      rental - the Rental object to add to the database.
      Returns:
      true if the rental was added successfully, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there was an error executing the SQL statement.

    • deleteRental

      Parameters:
      rental_id - the ID of the rental to delete from the database.
      Returns:
      true if the rental was deleted successfully, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there was an error executing the SQL statement.

    • getRental

      Retrieves a rental from the database.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the Rental object if it exists in the database, null otherwise.

      SQLException - if there was an error executing the SQL statement.

    • getRentalsByTenantsId

      public static List<Rental> getRentalsByTenantsId(int tenant_id) throws SQLException
      Retrieves all rentals from the database for a specific tenant.
      Parameters:
      tenant_id - the ID of the tenant to retrieve rentals for
      Returns:
      a list of Rental objects representing the rentals for the given tenant
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs while accessing the database

    • getRentalsByRoomId

      public static List<Rental> getRentalsByRoomId(int roomId) throws SQLException
      Retrieves all rentals for a given room ID from the database.
      Parameters:
      roomId - the ID of the room for which to retrieve rentals
      Returns:
      a List of Rental objects representing the rentals associated with the given room ID
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error accessing the database

    • getActiveRentals

      public static List<Rental> getActiveRentals() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all active rentals, i.e. rentals where the check out date is in the future compared to the current date.
      Returns:
      a List of Rental objects representing the active rentals
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error accessing the database

    • getPastRentals

      public static List<Rental> getPastRentals() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all past rentals, i.e. rentals where the check out date is in the past compared to the current date.
      Returns:
      a List of Rental objects representing the past rentals
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error accessing the database

    • getUnPainRentals

      public static List<Rental> getUnPainRentals() throws SQLException
      Updates the total amount owed for a rental by subtracting the specified amount paid from the rental's total amount.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error accessing the database

    • payRental

      public static void payRental(int rentalId, double amountPaid) throws SQLException
      Updates the total amount due for a rental by subtracting the specified amount paid
      Parameters:
      rentalId - The ID of the rental to update
      amountPaid - The amount paid towards the rental
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while accessing the database

    • getRentalAmount

      public static double getRentalAmount(int rentalId) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the total amount due for a rental
      Parameters:
      rentalId - The ID of the rental to retrieve the amount for
      Returns:
      The total amount due for the rental
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while accessing the database

    • updateRental

      public static int updateRental(Rental rental) throws SQLException
      Recieves the edited rental and checks if the room is available for the specified dates. If the room is available, the rental is updated with the new details. If the room is not available, the rental is not updated. It will return numbers to indicate the status of the update. 0 means the room is available and the rental can be updated. 1 means the room is not available because check in date overlaps with another rental. 2 means the room is not available because check out date overlaps with another rental. 3 means the room is not available because the check in date and check out date overlaps with another rental.
      Parameters:
      rental - The edited rental
      Returns:
      An integer indicating the status of the update
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while accessing the database
